intro: Gilia exserta, commonly known as the desert gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Gilia exserta is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
